content: simple crochet mat or dishcloth skill level beginner size approx 7 square materials 100 yds dk or worsted weight cotton yarn samples shown in numei cotton chenille size h/8 5 mm crochet hook or size needed to achieve gauge tapestry needle gauge not important for this project -- approximately 4 single_crochet = 1 on size h/8 5 mm hook terms/abbreviations beginning beg chain chain each ea repeat repeat single_crochet single_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch stitch st mat chain 24 single_crochet in second chain from hook and in ea chain across turn 23 single_crochet row 1 chain 1 single_crochet in first single_crochet and in ea single_crochet across turn repeat row 1 until 24 row have been completed but do not fasten_off edging chain 1 single_crochet in each single_crochet across top of mat work 3 single_crochet in last stitch of row to turn the corner single_crochet evenly along side of piece in every row or every other row as required to keep edging flat to next corner work 3 single_crochet in corner single_crochet in each free loop on opposite side of beg chain 1 work 3 single_crochet in next corner single_crochet evenly across remaining side work 3 single_crochet in last corner join with slip_stitch to first single_crochet where you began if you want a hanging loop at corner when you have completed the slip_stitch join on last round chain 8 slip_stitch back into corner point where you began fasten_off and weave in ends securely color-striped mat you can use several different colors to work a stripe pattern by working 4 row with one color then changing color for the next 4 row and repeating the four-row sequence until 24 row have been completed choose one color for the edging and hanging loop to make color changes in the last stitch before the color change work single_crochet until 2 loops remain on hook pull loop of new color through loops on hook then continue to work with new color drop the old color and carry it loosely up the side of your work until the next color change is needed work over the loose strands to hide them when you apply the final edging round alternatively cut strand at each color change leaving 4 tail
